Imagine typing a crucial note only to find it doesn't fit the space or looks like a tiny ant on your screen. This is a common gripe with apps like Microsoft Whiteboard, where resizing text can be tricky. A simple workaround is to use the app's zoom feature to get a closer look at your text and adjust the text box size using the corner handles[(source)](https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/msoffice/forum/all/microsoft-whiteboard-unable-to-change-font-size-on/55afc1da-50bf-4ce1-b0a7-b5c5d4053602). If the app doesn't support direct font resizing, consider using a text box instead of typing directly on shapes to maintain control over text size. ### Syncing Across Devices Another challenge is syncing text across multiple devices. You might type a brilliant idea on your Mac, only to find it missing on your iPad. To avoid this, ensure your app is set to automatically sync changes. Most apps offer cloud-based storage options—like iCloud or Google Drive—that facilitate seamless updates across devices. Double-check your network connection and app settings to ensure everything is syncing smoothly. ### Integration with Other Mac Apps Integration with other Mac applications can sometimes be a hurdle. You may want to export your whiteboard notes to a presentation or document. If your app doesn't support direct integration, look for export options such as PDF or image formats. These can then be imported into apps like Keynote or Pages. Additionally, some apps offer third-party integrations that can be set up to streamline this process. ### Tips for a Smooth Experience To enhance your experience, keep these tips in mind: Regularly update your apps to benefit from the latest features and bug fixes.
